column1: In his Appendix to ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', [[Christopher Tolkien]] noted the Elvish element or root ''pel-'' (signifying "go round, encircle").<ref>{{S
column2: Appendix}}</ref> It is unknown if he reconstructed this element from writings by [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column3: Tolkien]] which have appeared in print after [[1977]] (when the work was first published), or if he used manuscripts which still are unpublished.

column1: **[[Quenya]]: ''peltakse-'' ("a fence of fixed stakes etc., or a 'pale' and fencing stakes"); ''pelma'' ("a border, fringe, edge, limiting device")<ref name=PE17/><ref group=note>While appearing without any designated language, [[David Giraudeau]] has noted that ''peltakse-'' and ''pelma'' are likely Quenya forms (private correspondence with [[User:Morgan]], as of 13 July 2011).</ref>
In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root PELE, signifying "fence in".<ref>{{PE

column2: ''Etymologies'']] appears the roots PEL ("revolve on fixed point") and PEL(ES) (no signification given)<ref group=note>In the ''Addenda and Corrigenda'' is noted that Tolkien had added "cf. PEL-" to the entry on PEL(ES).</ref>. Among the derivatives are:<ref>{{LR
